title: Active Recall
description: Don't just re-read. Testing yourself is the most crucial component of learning. Use the 'Reveal Mode' in quizzes to force your brain to retrieve info before seeing options.

title: Spaced Repetition
description: Review info just before you're about to forget it. Follow the 'Study Schedule' on your dashboard—it's designed to hack the forgetting curve.

title: Retrospective Timetable
description: Instead of planning what to study next week, track what you studied today and color-code it based on how well you knew it (Red to Gold).

title: Big Picture (Why is this bad?)
description: Understand the 'Why' before the details. When learning a concept, ask 'Why is this bad?' or 'What happens if this fails?' to anchor the knowledge.

title: Verbal Recall
description: Verbally explaining a topic is much harder—and more effective—than simple recognition. Speak your answers out loud during study sessions.

title: Spatial Memory
description: Condense large amounts of info into single-page 'maps'. Remembering WHERE something was on a page helps you recall WHAT it was during the test.
